info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:49AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pope, Hardin, Massac, Caldwell, Marshall, McCracken, Hopkins, Lyon, Fulton, Calloway, Livingston, Crittenden, Hickman, Carlisle, Union, Webster and Graves Counties through 330 AM CST... At 247 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rosiclare Illinois to Lone Oak Kentucky to 6 miles west of Clayton Tennessee. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Paducah, Reidland, Lone Oak, Rosiclare and Brookport around 255 AM CST. Ledbetter around 300 AM CST. Calvert City around 305 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sturgis, Clinton, Cayce, Salem, Clay, Fulgham, Marion, Mayfield, Creswell, Sedalia and Farmersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for southern Illinois...western and northwestern Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
